intro: Hymenoxys ambigens var. ambigens, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the evening and close by dawn. The plant has hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The species is part of the family Pedaliaceae and is known for its short growing season and rapid life cycle.
